required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study To Assess The Anidulafungin And Voriconazole Concentration In Lung Following Intravenous Administration In Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 4, Open Label Study To Assess The Bronchopulmonary Pharmacokinetics Of Anidulafungin And Voriconazole Following Intravenous Administration In Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to provide anidulafungin and voriconazole to healthy subjects to determine the drug concentration in the lung.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma Pharmacokinetics (PK): Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 100 minutes (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 hours after start of infusion

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma PK: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 100 minutes (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 hours after start of infusion

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma PK: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Time = Tau (AUCtau)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 100 minutes (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 hours after start of infusion
100 minutes (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 hours after start of infusion
100 minutes (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 hours after start of infusion

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma PK: Volume of Distribution at Steady-state (Vss)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 100 minutes (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 hours after start of infusion

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Drug Penetration Ratio in ELF
Concentration Ratio in ELF to Plasma

intervention.description: Subjects will be admitted to the clinical research unit on Day 0. Subjects will receive anidulafungin intravenously in a loading dose of 200 mg on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg Q24h on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects will receive voriconazole in a loading dose of 6 mg/kg Q12h on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg Q12h on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adult subjects willing to comply with the study requirement.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinical significant disease.
- Sensitive to study medication.
- Not willing to comply with the study requirement.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

outcome.title: Plasma Pharmacokinetics (PK): Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
outcome.description: Cmax = maximum observed plasma concentration; measured in micrograms per milliliter (ug/mL). Observed directly from the data. Collected on Day 3.
outcome.time_frame: 100 minutes (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 hours after start of infusion

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: Plasma Pharmacokinetics (PK): Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
measure.description: Cmax = maximum observed plasma concentration; measured in micrograms per milliliter (ug/mL). Observed directly from the data. Collected on Day 3.

outcome.title: Plasma PK: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
outcome.description: Tmax = time (hours) to maximum plasma concentration (Cmax). Observed directly from data as time of first occurrence. Collected on Day 3.
outcome.time_frame: 100 minutes (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 hours after start of infusion

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: Plasma PK: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
measure.description: Tmax = time (hours) to maximum plasma concentration (Cmax). Observed directly from data as time of first occurrence. Collected on Day 3.

outcome.title: Plasma PK: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Time = Tau (AUCtau)
outcome.description: AUCtau = area under the plasma concentration-time profile from time zero (0) to time = t (AUCt), the dosing interval, where t is 24 hours for anidulafungin and 12 hours for voriconazole; measured as micrograms times hours per milliliter (ug*hr/mL). Collected on Day 3.
outcome.time_frame: 100 minutes (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 hours after start of infusion
outcome.population: PK parameter analysis population defined as all subjects randomized and treated who had at least 1 of the PK parameters of primary interest.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: Plasma PK: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Time = Tau (AUCtau)
measure.description: AUCtau = area under the plasma concentration-time profile from time zero (0) to time = t (AUCt), the dosing interval, where t is 24 hours for anidulafungin and 12 hours for voriconazole; measured as micrograms times hours per milliliter (ug*hr/mL). Collected on Day 3.
measure.population: PK parameter analysis population defined as all subjects randomized and treated who had at least 1 of the PK parameters of primary interest.

outcome.title: Plasma PK: Plasma Elimination Half-life (t1/2)
outcome.description: t1/2 = terminal elimination half-life in hours; Loge(2)/Kel, where Kel is the terminal phase rate constant calculated by a linear regression of the log-linear concentration-time curve. Collected on Day 3.
outcome.time_frame: 100 minutes (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 hours after start of infusion
outcome.population: PK parameter analysis population; (n) = number of subjects contributing to the mean

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: Plasma PK: Plasma Elimination Half-life (t1/2)
measure.description: t1/2 = terminal elimination half-life in hours; Loge(2)/Kel, where Kel is the terminal phase rate constant calculated by a linear regression of the log-linear concentration-time curve. Collected on Day 3.
measure.population: PK parameter analysis population; (n) = number of subjects contributing to the mean

outcome.title: Plasma PK: Total Clearance (CL Total)
outcome.description: CL total = total clearance calculated as dose divided by AUCt; measured as milliliters per minute (mL/min). Collected on Day 3.
outcome.time_frame: 100 minutes (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 hours after start of infusion

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: Plasma PK: Total Clearance (CL Total)
measure.description: CL total = total clearance calculated as dose divided by AUCt; measured as milliliters per minute (mL/min). Collected on Day 3.

outcome.title: Plasma PK: Volume of Distribution at Steady-state (Vss)
outcome.description: Vss = volume of distribution at steady-state; measured as liters (L). Calculated as (CL multiplied by mean residence time extrapolated to infinity [MRTinf]). MRTinf = [(AUMCt plus t (AUCinf minus AUCt)) divided by AUCt] minus (infusion time divided by 2); AUMCt = area under the first moment curve from time zero to time t; AUCinf = area under the plasma concentration-time curve extrapolated to infinity.
outcome.time_frame: 100 minutes (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 hours after start of infusion
outcome.population: PK parameter analysis population; (n) = number of subjects contributing to the mean.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: Plasma PK: Volume of Distribution at Steady-state (Vss)
measure.description: Vss = volume of distribution at steady-state; measured as liters (L). Calculated as (CL multiplied by mean residence time extrapolated to infinity [MRTinf]). MRTinf = [(AUMCt plus t (AUCinf minus AUCt)) divided by AUCt] minus (infusion time divided by 2); AUMCt = area under the first moment curve from time zero to time t; AUCinf = area under the plasma concentration-time curve extrapolated to infinity.
measure.population: PK parameter analysis population; (n) = number of subjects contributing to the mean.

outcome.title: Epithelial Lining Fluid (ELF) PK: Cmax
outcome.description: Cmax=maximum observed plasma concentration. ELF collected by bronchoscopy and bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) Day 3; determined from BAL sample using urea dilution method: [Drug ELF]=[Drug BAL] multiplied by [Urea SERUM] divided by [Urea BAL]. Drug ELF=anidulafungin or voriconazole (drug) concentration in ELF corrected for dilution; Drug BAL=assayed drug concentration in BAL; Urea SERUM and Urea BAL simultaneously collected. Summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects; associated to a single subject for reporting purposes (mean with standard deviation not calculated).
outcome.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: Epithelial Lining Fluid (ELF) PK: Cmax
measure.description: Cmax=maximum observed plasma concentration. ELF collected by bronchoscopy and bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) Day 3; determined from BAL sample using urea dilution method: [Drug ELF]=[Drug BAL] multiplied by [Urea SERUM] divided by [Urea BAL]. Drug ELF=anidulafungin or voriconazole (drug) concentration in ELF corrected for dilution; Drug BAL=assayed drug concentration in BAL; Urea SERUM and Urea BAL simultaneously collected. Summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects; associated to a single subject for reporting purposes (mean with standard deviation not calculated).
measure.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects.

outcome.title: ELF PK: Tmax
outcome.description: Tmax = time (hours) to maximum plasma concentration (Cmax). Observed directly from data as time of first occurrence. ELF collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3.
outcome.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: ELF PK: Tmax
measure.description: Tmax = time (hours) to maximum plasma concentration (Cmax). Observed directly from data as time of first occurrence. ELF collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3.
measure.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects.

outcome.title: ELF PK: AUCtau
outcome.description: AUCtau = area under the plasma concentration-time profile from time zero (0) to time = t (AUCt), the dosing interval, where t is 24 hours for anidulafungin and 12 hours for voriconazole. ELF collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3. Summary parameters were derived using average data for all subjects and associated to a single subject for reporting purposes (mean with standard deviation was not calculated).
outcome.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: ELF PK: AUCtau
measure.description: AUCtau = area under the plasma concentration-time profile from time zero (0) to time = t (AUCt), the dosing interval, where t is 24 hours for anidulafungin and 12 hours for voriconazole. ELF collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3. Summary parameters were derived using average data for all subjects and associated to a single subject for reporting purposes (mean with standard deviation was not calculated).
measure.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects.

outcome.title: ELF PK: t1/2
outcome.description: t1/2 = terminal elimination half-life in hours; Loge(2)/Kel, where Kel is the terminal phase rate constant calculated by a linear regression of the log-linear concentration-time curve. ELF collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3.
outcome.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects. Data in ELF did not allow calculation of t1/2; not analyzed.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: ELF PK: t1/2
measure.description: t1/2 = terminal elimination half-life in hours; Loge(2)/Kel, where Kel is the terminal phase rate constant calculated by a linear regression of the log-linear concentration-time curve. ELF collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3.
measure.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects. Data in ELF did not allow calculation of t1/2; not analyzed.

outcome.title: Alveolar Macrophages (AM): Cmax
outcome.description: Cmax = maximum observed plasma concentration; observed directly from the data. AM collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3. Summary parameters were derived using average data for all subjects and associated to a single subject for reporting purposes (mean with standard deviation was not calculated).
outcome.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: Alveolar Macrophages (AM): Cmax
measure.description: Cmax = maximum observed plasma concentration; observed directly from the data. AM collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3. Summary parameters were derived using average data for all subjects and associated to a single subject for reporting purposes (mean with standard deviation was not calculated).
measure.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects.

outcome.title: AM: Tmax
outcome.description: Tmax = time (hours) to maximum plasma concentration (Cmax). Observed directly from data as time of first occurrence. AM collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3.
outcome.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: AM: Tmax
measure.description: Tmax = time (hours) to maximum plasma concentration (Cmax). Observed directly from data as time of first occurrence. AM collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3.
measure.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects.

outcome.title: AM: AUCtau
outcome.description: AUCtau = area under the plasma concentration-time profile from time zero (0) to time = t (AUCt), the dosing interval, where t is 24 hours for anidulafungin and 12 hours for voriconazole. AM collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3. Summary parameters were derived using average data for all subjects and associated to a single subject for reporting purposes (mean with standard deviation was not calculated).
outcome.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: AM: AUCtau
measure.description: AUCtau = area under the plasma concentration-time profile from time zero (0) to time = t (AUCt), the dosing interval, where t is 24 hours for anidulafungin and 12 hours for voriconazole. AM collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3. Summary parameters were derived using average data for all subjects and associated to a single subject for reporting purposes (mean with standard deviation was not calculated).
measure.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects.

outcome.title: AM: t1/2
outcome.description: t1/2 = terminal elimination half-life in hours; Loge(2)Kel, where Kel is the terminal phase rate constant calculated by a linear regression of the log-linear concentration-time curve. AM collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3.
outcome.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects. Data in AM did not allow calculation of t1/2; not analyzed.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: AM: t1/2
measure.description: t1/2 = terminal elimination half-life in hours; Loge(2)Kel, where Kel is the terminal phase rate constant calculated by a linear regression of the log-linear concentration-time curve. AM collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3.
measure.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects. Data in AM did not allow calculation of t1/2; not analyzed.

outcome.title: Overall Drug Penetration Ratio in ELF
outcome.description: ELF collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3. ELF to plasma penetration ratio calculated by dividing area under the plasma concentration-time profile (AUC) in ELF by AUC in plasma from 20 subjects where t is 24 hours for anidulafungin and 12 hours for voriconazole. Summary parameters were derived using average data for all subjects and associated to a single subject for reporting purposes (mean with standard deviation was not calculated).
outcome.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: Overall Drug Penetration Ratio in ELF
measure.description: ELF collected by bronchoscopy and BAL on Day 3. ELF to plasma penetration ratio calculated by dividing area under the plasma concentration-time profile (AUC) in ELF by AUC in plasma from 20 subjects where t is 24 hours for anidulafungin and 12 hours for voriconazole. Summary parameters were derived using average data for all subjects and associated to a single subject for reporting purposes (mean with standard deviation was not calculated).
measure.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects.

outcome.title: Concentration Ratio in ELF to Plasma
outcome.description: Concentration ratio in ELF to plasma determined by a point estimate within each subject at the time-point where ELF data was available.
outcome.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects. Subjects randomized to a single BAL procedure timepoint; bronchoscopy and BAL done for 5 different subjects at each timepoint.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

measure.title: Concentration Ratio in ELF to Plasma
measure.description: Concentration ratio in ELF to plasma determined by a point estimate within each subject at the time-point where ELF data was available.
measure.population: PK parameter analysis population; summary parameters derived using average data for all subjects. Subjects randomized to a single BAL procedure timepoint; bronchoscopy and BAL done for 5 different subjects at each timepoint.

group.title: Anidulafungin and Voriconazole
group.description: Anidulafungin (Eraxis™) intravenously (IV) in a loading dose of 200 milligrams (mg) on Day 1, followed by maintenance doses of 100 mg every 24 hours on Day 2 and Day 3. Simultaneously, using a separate intravenous access, subjects received voriconazole (Vfend®) in a loading dose of 6 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) every 12 hours on Day 1, followed by a maintenance dose of 4 mg/kg every 12 hours on Day 2, and a 4 mg/kg morning dose on Day 3.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
